pr_title: feat: Move code from physical to logical plan for Projection

timeline.bodyText:
What is the correspondence between DataSource and Materialization? Why do their schemas differ? If the Materialization is a table, then shouldn't the schema of the DataSource match that of the table? I.e not have the rowtime and key in the value?
Why do the output schemas of the pull query and FinalProjectNode differ? Basically, it seems that the output schemas of persistent queries are different than that of pull queries? Moreover, the output schema of FinalProjectNode seems to have extra columns that are not in the projection. Why?

Off the top of my head (see bottom), I don't know the answers to these questions (and I'm not sure that without digging anyone on the team knows) but I think these are exactly the ones we need to answer (and document for the future! Ideally in the code...) before merging this pr. Then, we can see if we can change it to be a single code path for both persistent/pull queries.
Otherwise (if we can't merge the code paths), I think we need to have two different logical nodes since they (logically) represent different operations and construct different schemas (they can extend a common base so that it's clear which code they share and which is different). We shouldn't make the pull and persistent code more intertwined but with a nuanced difference as it will make it harder to develop them independently without context on the other.
FWIW, you can change the behavior of any logical node of the persistent queries so long as the QTT tests pass. Any old query will continue to work because the physical plans are persisted, not the logical ones, in the command topic.


Moreover, the output schema of FinalProjectNode seems to have extra columns that are not in the projection.

My best guess on this one is that the rowkey-in-value/rowtime-in-value/windowstart/windowend columns are needed to handle the processing. At the moment, the way we've coded it up, most operations accept only the value and not the key (or other metadata information) - so we need to copy information from the key into the value. I've looked into changing this and I got pretty close, but the problem is that the Joiner code in streams doesn't yet have the signature that I need to fully get rid of it so I abandoned the change. I'll try to revisit it (and hopefully change that in streams if necessary) at some point.
timeline.author: agavra

timeline.bodyText: What exactly is the difference between FinalProjectNode and ProjectNode?
timeline.author: AlanConfluent

timeline.bodyText:
One nice benefit of splitting this up is that it's easier to throw errors for things that are not supported.  E.g. we could throw an error if there's a group by?  Where is this currently done at the moment?  It seems like at the very least we have the error Error in translating logical to physical plan for pull queries: unrecognized logical node. but ideally this should be caught at the logical layer.
Should we do some of these checks here and throw errors if there are unsupported expressions?
timeline.author: AlanConfluent

replies.bodyText: Some of the checks about about for instance the group by are performed in the Analyzer and specifically, by the class PullQueryValidator. The rest of the checks about the WHERE clause will be performed when building the filter node and will be in the next PR
replies.author: vpapavas

timeline.bodyText:
The intermediate schema is only used to evaluate these select expressions, right?
I assume that for the where clause, you'd effectively have access to the same columns and want to build the same schema for evaluating those expressions.  Will you be able to share this or will you have to rebuild it in the SelectNode?
timeline.author: AlanConfluent

replies.bodyText: Yeah, for the next PR that does the WHERE clause I would have to share this schema. I will build it once in the WHERE and then the PROJECT since it sits above, will be able to get if from it. If a WHERE doesn't exist, then the PROJECT will build it
replies.author: vpapavas

timeline.bodyText: Should this be package private and @VisibleForTesting?
timeline.author: AlanConfluent

timeline.bodyText: If you just apply the transform immediately, can you just call it directly rather than returning a function?
timeline.author: AlanConfluent

timeline.bodyText: Maybe this should be called getIntermediateRow to match the terminology of the logical node?
timeline.author: AlanConfluent

timeline.bodyText: But that's fine because this intermediate schema is never exposed, right?  The output schema puts these fields correctly as keys.
timeline.author: AlanConfluent

timeline.bodyText: This is just to use the SelectValueMapper, right?
timeline.author: AlanConfluent

timeline.bodyText: Does this mean ExpressionTypeManager expects it?  That's the main place where this schema is used is just to evaluate the type of the expression.
timeline.author: AlanConfluent

replies.bodyText: Also, the CodeGenRunner uses the schema
replies.author: vpapavas

replies.bodyText: I guess I just meant that schema is only used with the ExpressionTypeManager and the comment is a bit misleading.
replies.author: AlanConfluent

timeline.author: agavra

timeline.bodyText:
excuse me while I philosophize for a bit...
just wondering, is 'child' and 'parent' standard terminology in databases when discussing logical plans? I know we've standardized on it, but it always confuses me because the "child" is the "source node" which makes me feel like it's a "parent" 🤔
What do you think about upstream/downstream nodes? That way it's clear that the direction of data is flowing from the source nodes (upstream) to the sink nodes (downstream)
timeline.author: agavra

replies.bodyText:
The plans (logical, physical) are trees hence the terminology root, child, parent. The children are the leaves and as we move up the tree we visit from child to parent. Information and rows is flowing from the leaves towards the root.
Honestly, sorry but I find the upstream/downstream more confusing :(
replies.author: vpapavas

replies.bodyText: 😂 haha i'll keep working at making it feel intuitive!
replies.author: agavra

timeline.bodyText: any reason this is no longer final?
timeline.author: agavra
